Description of all existing or potential anti-takeover measures of the company

In the management report, the management board provides an overview of all existing or potential anti-takeover measures of the company and also indicates under which circumstances and by whom these measures can be taken.
Description of an alternative measure taken within the framework of the principles or best practice provision

Where applicable, a description of the alternative measure and an explanation how that measure reaches the underlying objective of the best practice provision, or a clarification how the measure contributes to good corporate governance of the company.

Description of any major failings in the internal risk management and control systems identified during the financial year and the discussion of these topics with the audit committee and the supervisory board

The management board accounts in the management report for any major failings in the internal risk management and control systems identified during the financial year, any significant changes made to these systems, any significant improvements to these systems and the discussion of these topics with the audit committee and the supervisory board.

Report of the supervisory board
The annual report of the company includes a report of the supervisory board. In this report, the supervisory board accounts for its supervision during the past financial year.

Description of the composition of the committee

In the report of the supervisory board, the board reports on the performance of the duties of the committees during the financial year. In it, among other things, the composition of the committees is mentioned.

Description of conclusions and recommendations or alternative measures arising from the annual analysis of the supervisory board regarding the need for internal audit function and assessment of whether adequate alternative measures have been taken.
Description of the design of the internal risk management and control systems
The management board accounts in the management report for the design of the internal risk management and control systems.
Description of the discussions held by the supervisory board on matters on which the audit committee reports
The supervisory board discusses matters on which the audit committee reports. The discussions should be described in the report of the supervisory board.
Description how the evaluation of management and individual managing directors has taken place
The report of the supervisory board mentions, among other things, the manner in which the evaluation of the management board and the individual directors took place.
Description of the way in which the evaluation of the supervisory board, the separate committees and the individual supervisory directors has taken place
The report of the Supervisory Board mentions, among other things, how the evaluation of the Supervisory Board, individual committees and individual Supervisory Board members took place.
Description of the execution of tasks by the committees during the financial year
In the report of the supervisory board, the board reports on the performance of the duties of the committees during the financial year.
Description of the execution of the policy of institutional investors relating to the exercise of voting rights in the relevant financial year
Institutional investors report annually on their website and/or in their management report on the execution of their policy relating to the exercise of voting rights in the relevant financial year.
Description of the execution of the risk assessment, the key risks the company faces and the risk appetite of the company

The management board accounts in the management report for the execution of the risk assessment and describes the key risks the company faces and the risk appetite of the company. This may include strategic, operational, financial, compliance and non-financial risks.
Description of the implementation of a culture within the company that is focused on sustainable long-term value creation
In the management report the management board explains the implementation of a culture within the company that is focused on long-term value creation.
Description of the manner in which the contact is arranged between the supervisory board and the executive committee
Description of the number of committee meetings

In the report of the supervisory board, the board reports on the performance of the duties of the committees during the financial year. This states, among other things, the number of meetings of the committees.
Description of the operation of the internal risk management and control systems over the past year and how these systems contributed to mitigate and control the risks

The management board accounts in the management report for the operation of the internal risk management and control systems over the past year and how these systems contributed to mitigate and control the risks.
Description of the reasons why the supervisory board does follow the advice of the audit committee regarding the appointment of the external auditor

If the supervisory board does not follow the advice of the audit committee regarding the appointment of the external auditor, the arguments are communicated to the general meeting and mentioned in the report of the supervisory board.
Description of the role, duties and composition of the executive committee
Description of the way in which the board was involved in the formulation and supervision of the implementation of the strategy
Description of the way in which the company has deviated from the principles or best practice provision
A textual description of the way the company has deviated from the best practice provision.
Description of transactions between the company and natural or legal persons that hold at least ten percent of the shares in the company that are agreed at arm's length

All transactions between the company and legal or natural persons who hold at least ten percent of the shares in the company are agreed at arm's length. Decisions to enter into transactions with these persons that are of material significance to the company and/or to such persons require the approval of the supervisory board. Such transactions are disclosed in the management report.
Description of transactions involving conflicts of interest of managing or supervisory directors

All transactions involving conflicts of interest of managing or supervisory directors are agreed at arm's length. Decisions to enter into transactions involving conflicting interests of managing or supervisory directors that are of material significance to the company and/or the relevant managing or supervisory directors require the approval of the supervisory board. Such transactions are disclosed in the management report, including a description of the conflict of interest.

Description of how the variable remuneration contributes to sustainable long-term value creation, predetermined and measurable performance criteria of which the variable remuneration is made dependent and relationship between remuneration and performance

Description of the follow-up to the conclusions arising from the evaluations of the management board or the supervisory board
The report of the supervisory board mentions, among other things, what has been or will be done with the conclusions of the evaluations.
Description of when the company expects to comply with the principles or best practice provision
If the deviation of the best practice provision is temporary and lasts more than one year, it is indicated when the company expects to comply with the best practice provision again.
Description of which supervisory directors have been frequently absent from the meetings of the supervisory board
The report of the supervisory board includes a description of which supervisory directors have been frequently absent from meetings of the supervisory board.
